intro: Hippaton tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted whipstick, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and has a sprawling, creeping growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Hippaton tortuosum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover.
